simulated_ratings.title: Going My Way (1944)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wholesome music and heart made me smile and mist up in that classic Hollywood way.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Inspiring and handsomely told, it had me cheering by the finish line.

simulated_ratings.title: Son of Flubber (1963)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy, gadget-y fun with that cozy vintage Disney charm.

simulated_ratings.title: Nights in Rodanthe (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Swept up by the tender second-chance romance, even with the melodrama.

simulated_ratings.title: I Can Only Imagine (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Faith, forgiveness, and a moving father-son arc hit an uplifting note.

simulated_ratings.title: Sergeant York (1941)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-fashioned valor and conscience made for a stirring, dignified tale.

simulated_ratings.title: What to Expect When You're Expecting (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pleasant, scattered laughs and sweetness, if a bit uneven.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeously bittersweet and musical, it lingered like a beautiful sigh.

simulated_ratings.title: As it is in Heaven (Så som i himmelen) (2004)

simulated_ratings.title: Harriet (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inspiring, courageous, and heartfelt—history told with spirit.

simulated_ratings.title: Soul Surfer (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A hopeful, faith-tinged comeback story that left me encouraged.

simulated_ratings.title: Free Fall (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intimate and tender, though a touch heavier than my usual comfort zone.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp and energetic, but the edginess isn’t quite my style.

simulated_ratings.title: Last Song, The (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet, tear-tugging family and first love themes hit the spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Birth of a Nation, The (1915)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Technically historic but morally repellent, it left a bitter taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Tyler Perry's Diary of a Mad Black Woman (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad but earnest, with a satisfying arc of healing and self-worth.

simulated_ratings.title: Fireproof (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sincere, faith-forward marriage drama that felt redemptive.

simulated_ratings.title: If I Stay (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Melancholy and musical, touching if a bit heavy-handed.

simulated_ratings.title: Express, The (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rousing and respectful, an uplifting sports biopic.

simulated_ratings.title: War Room (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Well-meaning and heartfelt, if a bit on-the-nose.

simulated_ratings.title: Swing Time (1936)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dazzling dance, delightful romance—pure classic movie joy.

simulated_ratings.title: Vow, The (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle, hopeful love story that made me root for a second chance.

simulated_ratings.title: White Christmas (1954)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Holiday comfort at its finest—songs, romance, and warm nostalgia.

simulated_ratings.title: Taking Chance (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quietly profound and respectful, it left me reflective and grateful.
